$  author_id = '',

$  comment = ''

Link two objects in the Database.

Link two objects. Note that we can specify the order of the links in cases where this matters (e.g., authorship)

Parameters:
source_id Source object
target_id Target object
relationship_id Type of relationship
serial_number Order in which object link occurs. By default is 1.
author_id Internal object id of person or process making edit
ip IP address of editor
comment Comment

db_update_attribute_value ( $  object_id,
$  attribute_table,
$  attribute_id,
$  attribute_value,
$  author_id = '',
$  ip = '127.0.0.1',
$  comment = '' 
)

Store an attribute value.

Store an attribute for object, and record this operation in the edit table. The edits are timestamped so we know when they were done, and by whom. If the an attribute of this type for this object already exists, modify the timestamp of the previous value, and insert the new value. This generates a version history that we can reconstruct.

Parameters:
object_id Internal object id (a MD5 hash)
attribute_table Name of attribute table (one of EAV_Date, EAV_Int, EAV_Memo, EAV_Real, EAV_String)
attribute_id Attribute id (defined in table "attributes")
attribute_value Internal object id (a MD5 hash)
author_id Internal object id of person or process making edit
ip IP address of editor
comment Comment
